Having nothing els of
e state to signifie unto your L.
I am forced for my self to be importunat unto you,
and to beseeche you very humbly, to be a meanes unto
her Hig
es
for my licence to returne: or if there be any
other stay, to vouchsafe to remove it. For her M
tie
I heare, hath considered my necessitie, and hath gratiously
mised,
t
now I doe not doubt, but a very small
part of your honorable favour may
cure
e
for-
mance: whereof I rest most desirous,
and so I take
my humble leave. Fr
